{include "affiliate_loader"} Join us for our virtual event to hear a performance from musical guest Nathaniel Rateliff. {include "pre-header-spacing"}{beacon}

{include "default_salutation"} –

We knew our 2020 Bill of Rights Event was going to be one for the books. This is our first virtual fundraising event; we have an incredible lineup of community leader speakers and awardees, and the opportunity to hear from two criminal legal experts for our keynote conversation. And now, this event just got even bigger.

We are excited to announce Nathaniel Rateliff as our musical guest for this year's Bill of Rights Event. As an outspoken critic of Greenwood Village's resolution to undermine Colorado's recently passed police accountability bill, Rateliff has promised he will not perform at the city's Fiddler's Green amphitheater until the resolution is reversed.

To hear directly from Nathaniel Rateliff, join us on Thursday, October 1, for our Bill of Rights Event.

Bill of Rights Event

Join us for our annual Bill of Rights Event to celebrate our victories, hear from our community leaders and activists, and learn from our keynote speakers.

Thursday, October 1, 6 p.m.
Virtual
Event details will be sent at a later date.

RSVP Today


When you register for this year's Bill of Rights Event, you also sign up to hear from our incredible keynote speakers, CeCe McDonald and Elisabeth Epps. CeCe McDonald is a Minneapolis-based, transgender activist working to dismantle the prison industrial complex. Elisabeth Epps is a founder of the Colorado Freedom Fund and the ACLU of Colorado's very own Smart Justice organizer.

We are also honored to celebrate the work of community leaders through our Bill of Rights Awards. We will present the Reverend Dr. Timothy Tyler and Dr. Nita Mosby Tyler with the Carle Whitehead Memorial Award for their steadfast fight against racism, misogyny, homophobia, and economic injustice. Casa de Paz will receive the Ralph L. Carr Award for its outstanding work supporting detained immigrants and their families.

Please consider making a tax-deductible donation to the ACLU of CO to sponsor this event.

All funds raised by the Bill of Rights Event provide crucial support to sustain and expand ACLU of Colorado's advocacy, communication, and education work throughout Colorado. We hope you can join us!

ACLU of {affiliate_name}
